title: Anne-Marie Slaughter - Wikipedia
snippet: Anne-Marie Slaughter (born September 27, 1958) is an American lawyer and political scientist, and author.

title: Anne-Marie Slaughter
snippet: In 2009 Secretary of State Hillary Clinton appointed her as the first woman Director of Policy Planning in the U.S. State Department. Slaughter has written and lectured widely on global network design and leadership; on gender equality and elevating ...

title: BIOGRAPHY: Anne-Marie Slaughter
snippet: Anne-Marie Slaughter is the President and CEO of New America and the Bert G. Kerstetter â€™66 University Professor Emerita of Politics and International Affairs at Princeton University. From 2009-2011 she served as the director of Policy Planning for the United States Department of State, the first woman to hold that position.

title: slaughtr | Princeton School of Public and International Affairs
snippet: Anne-Marie Slaughter was the first woman to serve as director of policy planning for the U.S. Department of State. She served as dean of the Princeton School of Public and International Affairs from 2002 to 2009.For more information, visit ...

title: Anne-Marie Slaughter | World Leaders Forum
snippet: Anne-Marie Slaughter is currently the Bert G. Kerstetter '66 University Professor of Politics and International Affairs at Princeton University.
